Description: A hollow terracotta model of a sword-hilt, with ribbed grip and oval-loop pommel with a knob on top. Modelled on both sides, and complete in itself: there is no blade. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with a darker surface. Traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Roman, probably mid-second to third century AD: compare ring-pommel swords (without knob) in Feugère 2002: 123 and 165–6. Comparanda: Close but with loop pommel hollowed out: Török 1995: nos 308 and 309, dated late Hellenistic or early Roman. Near: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1872.406, acquired by the vendor in Elephantine. Near (no knob): Skupinska-Løvset 1978: no. UT 151, dated Hellenistic. Near (complete model sword; no knob on top of pommel): Breccia 1934: pl. cxxi:706. See also Allen 1985: no. 159 from Soknopaiou Nesos, dated mid-third century AD or earlier.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3297)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
